特記事項:
この授業を履修するには、事前にレベル認定の申請が必要です。詳細は備考欄を確認してください。

本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。 The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法:
This is NOT a lecture class or an English skills class (You will be able to strengthen English skills through taking the class). The teacher will introduce topics each week. Students are expected to actively contribute to class topics, including making comments and asking questions.

For Students permitted to take classes online: Due to the evolving public health situation, and in line with KGU policy, this course will be offered "on-demand" for those students permitted to do so. Please check your @kwansei.ac.jp email address regularly. I will be using my email address (kangaku.classes@gmail.com) so, please check that these emails are read. We will try to cover most of the course contents outlined below but this will probably be asynchronously (I will specify the deadline when I set the assignment). Do not worry, there will be some misunderstandings, and we will work through these issues together as best as we can.

第1回:
Week 1: Introductions and course overview
All 14 sessions are conducted face-to-face.
第3回: Week 3:Trends of modern life in Japan
第4回: Week 4:Thinking about social issues in Japan
第9回: Week 9:Traditional and modern Japanese rituals and ceremonies
トピック.授業外学習2:
Students will learn research skills, advanced communication skills teamwork skills and about social responsibility and research ethics in this course. They will then be required to actively use these skills to do research on a topic chosen by the teacher or the class. They will work with class members to present and give feedback as they work on their projects to improve them and produce a final report and present it to a larger audience.

Open to KGU students, first year and above. Students must be self-directed, hard-working with good communication skills and to be willing to work closely with other students.
